UI_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion, indicating that the closure was a result of government pressure1. The center officially announced its shutdown in May 2023, citing "unpreventable circumstances" as the reason for ceasing operations4. This event is part of a broader crackdown on LGBTQ spaces and advocacy groups in China2. The closure has been seen as symbolic of the diminishing availability of community spaces for queer individuals in the country3.
traffic_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion, indicating that the closure was a result of government pressure [[1]]. The center officially announced its shutdown in May 2023, citing "unpreventable circumstances" as the reason for ceasing operations [[4]]. This event is part of a broader crackdown on LGBTQ spaces and advocacy groups in China [[2]]. The closure has been seen as symbolic of the diminishing availability of community spaces for queer individuals in the country [[3]].
